author: NASS
description:
I used a new colorization technique, restored and applied face restoration, and created a sound design for this video of Japan in the 1920s (see so much of the Japanese culture before the war). This rare footage brings to life daily traditions, clothing, and urban life from nearly a century ago. It offers a vivid window into a world that has largely disappeared, preserving history through restoration.

Video Restoration Process:
✔ FPS boosted to 60 frames per second 
✔ Image resolution boosted up to HD 
✔ Improved video sharpness and brightness 
✔ Colorized only for the ambiance (not historically accurate)
✔added sound only for the ambiance
✔restoration:(stabilisation,denoise,cleand,deblur) 

Please, be aware that colorization colors are not real and fake, colorization was made only for the ambiance and do not represent real historical data.

B&W Video Source: A/V Geeks

Many thanks to A/V Geeks for all their hard work and dedication in preserving archival sources. (Please Support Him
title: Japan 1920s in color, Tokyo to Nikko by Train [60fps,Remastered] w/sound design added
